pr_title: Preserve launcher animation by not animating IntentHandler finish

timeline.bodyText: Silly question: don't we still want a finish() here?
timeline.author: david-allison-1

replies.bodyText:
See, now that's why everyone needs someone to review their stuff. I thought, nah, not important but you force me to justify myself (how dare you! ;-) ) and when I read up on it, apparently IntentHandler will be "back-able" unless I finish it. Also the "teardown" lifecycle methods won't be called (onPause/onStop/onDestroy - depending on where you are when finish is called) but that's not important here.
Will fix and repush
replies.author: mikehardy

timeline.message:
Preserve launcher animation by not animating IntentHandler finish

Fixes #5143 by letting IntentHandler just finish, if it specifies an animation
it actually clobbers whatever system launcher animation is specified.

Pixel Launcher seems to override the override but Nova Launcher respects it,
meaning you don't get the Nova Launcher animation you configure
